sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Assessing International General Insurance (NasdaqCM:IGIC)’s Valuation After RBC Capital’s Renewed Outperform Call
feed.summary: RBC Capital has resumed coverage on International General Insurance Holdings (IGIC) with an "Outperform" call, highlighting its disciplined underwriting and long-term prospects. Despite recent stock momentum and a strong three-year return, IGIC's valuation suggests it remains undervalued at $25.24 compared to a fair value of $32.00, driven by growth opportunities in global infrastructure and engineering projects. Investors are encouraged to assess the full narrative to understand the projected earnings path and potential risks like competitive pressure and currency volatility.

feed.title: Assessing International General Insurance (NasdaqCM:IGIC)’s Valuation After RBC Capital’s Renewed Outperform Call
feed.summary: RBC Capital has resumed coverage on International General Insurance Holdings (IGIC) with an Outperform rating, noting its strong long-term prospects. The stock is currently trading at a discount to analyst targets despite recent price momentum and a significant three-year return. Simply Wall St's narrative valuation suggests IGIC is 21.1% undervalued, with a fair value of $32.00, driven by opportunities in global infrastructure and engineering projects.

feed.title: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd.'s (NASDAQ:IGIC): Top Key Executive Wasef Jabsheh Is the Most Bullish Insider, and Their Stock Value Gained 5.3% Last Week
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ:IGIC) saw its stock value gain 5.3% last week, with top key executive Wasef Jabsheh identified as the most bullish insider, holding 34% of outstanding shares. Insiders collectively own 41% of the company, showing a significant vested interest in its growth. Institutional investors hold 22% and private equity firms hold 23%, while the general public holds 14%.

feed.title: Does RBC’s Renewed Confidence in IGIC’s Underwriting Discipline Reveal a Durable Edge in Soft Markets?
feed.summary: RBC Capital Markets has resumed coverage of International General Insurance Holdings (IGIC) with an “Outperform” rating, highlighting the insurer’s disciplined underwriting and consistent profitability in a softening market. This endorsement supports IGIC's strategy to maintain margins through careful management and growth in specialized reinsurance areas. While positive, investors should also be mindful of potential pressures from continued softening in long-tail pricing and increased competition.

feed.title: Westwood Holdings Group Inc. Sells 709,660 Shares of International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. $IGIC
feed.summary: Westwood Holdings Group Inc. significantly reduced its stake in International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ:IGIC) by 84.3%, selling 709,660 shares and retaining 131,991 shares valued at $3.17 million. Despite missing Q3 earnings estimates, International General Insurance has a consensus "Buy" rating from analysts with a $31.50 price target. The company also announced a $5.0 million share buyback and a quarterly dividend of $0.05 per share, signaling management's belief in the stock's undervaluation.

feed.title: International General Insurance (NASDAQ:IGIC) Given "Outperform" Rating at Royal Bank Of Canada
feed.summary: Royal Bank of Canada initiated coverage of International General Insurance (NASDAQ:IGIC) with an "Outperform" rating and a $28.00 price target, suggesting an 11.7% upside. The company reported Q3 EPS of $0.87, slightly missing estimates, but maintained a strong net margin of 23.76% and a return on equity of 18.36%. International General Insurance's board also approved a $5.0 million share repurchase program, indicating management believes the stock is undervalued, while institutional investors hold approximately 54% of the shares.

feed.title: RBC Capital resumes International General Insurance stock coverage with Outperform rating
feed.summary: RBC Capital has resumed coverage of International General Insurance Holdings (NASDAQ:IGIC) with an Outperform rating and a $28.00 price target, noting the company's strong underwriting margins and global growth potential. The firm also anticipates a 4%+ dividend yield and approximately 5% share buyback program in 2026/27, highlighting IGIC's commitment to returning capital to shareholders and excellent capital stewardship. This assessment comes despite acknowledging near-term macro headwinds facing the insurer.

feed.title: Ex-Dividend Reminder: International General Insurance Holdings, Meritage Homes and Upbound Group
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd (IGIC), Meritage Homes Corp (MTH), and Upbound Group Inc (UPBD) are scheduled to trade ex-dividend on December 17, 2025. IGIC will pay $0.05, MTH will pay $0.43, and UPBD will pay $0.39 in their upcoming quarterly dividends. Based on recent stock prices, shares of these companies are expected to open lower by 0.21%, 0.60%, and 2.14% respectively, all else being equal.

feed.title: Technical Reactions to IGIC Trends in Macro Strategies
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ: IGIC) is exhibiting a neutral sentiment across all time horizons, indicating a wait-and-see approach. The article outlines three distinct AI-generated trading strategies—Position, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—with specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels. These strategies are underpinned by a strong 21.4:1 risk-reward setup, targeting a 6.3% gain against a minimal 0.3% risk.

feed.title: IGI Declares Quarterly Dividend for Q3 2025
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGIC) announced a quarterly dividend of $0.05 per share for Q3 2025, payable on December 31, 2025, to shareholders of record by December 17, 2025. This decision, aimed at returning value to shareholders, aligns with a "Buy" analyst rating and a $28.00 price target for IGIC stock. TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, also rates IGIC as "Outperform," citing strong financial performance and attractive valuation.

feed.title: IGI Declares $0.05 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. announced a quarterly dividend of $0.05 per share for Q3 2025. The dividend is payable on December 31, 2025, to shareholders recorded as of December 17, 2025.

feed.title: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ:IGIC) Plans $0.05 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ:IGIC) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.05 per share, payable on December 31st to shareholders of record on December 17th. This translates to an annualized dividend of $0.20 and a yield of 0.8%. The dividend is well-covered by earnings, with a payout ratio of 6.4%, and analysts project a future payout ratio near 6.6%.

feed.title: IGI Announces Quarterly Ordinary Common Share Dividend
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) has declared an ordinary common share dividend of $0.05 per share for the period spanning July 1, 2025, to September 30, 2025. Shareholders of record by December 17, 2025, will receive this dividend, which is scheduled for payment on December 31, 2025. IGI is a specialty risks commercial insurer and reinsurer, rated "A" (Excellent)/Stable by AM Best and "A" (Strong)/Stable by S&P Global Ratings.

feed.title: Ballast Asset Management LP Sells 215,159 Shares of International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. $IGIC
feed.summary: Ballast Asset Management LP sold 215,159 shares of International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ:IGIC), reducing its stake by 74.7% to 72,897 shares. Despite the company missing quarterly earnings expectations, analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with a $31.50 price target. International General Insurance's board also authorized a $5.0 million share repurchase program.

feed.title: IGI Announces New 5 Million Common Share Repurchase Authorization
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) has announced a new authorization from its Board of Directors to repurchase up to 5 million shares of its common stock. This authorization replaces a previous 7.5 million share repurchase program which has been fully utilized. The repurchases will be subject to market conditions and other factors outlined in the company's forward-looking statements.

feed.title: S&P upgrades IGI’s financial strength rating to “A”
feed.summary: S&P Global Ratings has upgraded the financial strength rating of International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) to "A" from "A-", along with the long-term issuer credit rating of IGI Bermuda, and assigned a stable outlook. This upgrade reflects IGI's consistent outperformance in underwriting results compared to higher-rated peers and the market average. Waleed Jabsheh, President & CEO of IGI, welcomed the decision as a recognition of the company's strong operating performance and disciplined approach.

feed.title: IGI Holdings (IGIC) Profit Margin Improves to 23.3%, Reinforcing Bullish Earnings Narratives
feed.summary: IGI Holdings (IGIC) has reported improved net profit margins of 23.3%, although annual earnings growth has slowed to 13.2% from a five-year average of 30.9%. The company's strategic portfolio shifts and expansion into new markets are credited with supporting these margins and are expected to drive revenue growth, despite competitive pressures and a lower P/E ratio compared to its peers. The stock trades well below its estimated fair value, offering potential upside if it achieves projected earnings growth and margin improvements.

feed.title: IGI to Release Second Quarter and Half Year 2025 Financial Results on August 5, 2025
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) announced it will release its second-quarter and half-year 2025 financial results on Tuesday, August 5, 2025, after market close. The company will host an investor teleconference and Q&A session on Wednesday, August 6, 2025, to discuss these results. Details about accessing the results and the teleconference are provided.

feed.title: IGI Announces Increase in Quarterly Ordinary Common Share Dividend
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) announced that its Board of Directors has approved an increase in the quarterly ordinary common share dividend to $0.05 per share, effective June 18, 2025. This represents a 100% increase from the previous rate of $0.025 per share. The dividend will be paid to shareholders of record as of June 2, 2025.

feed.title: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGIC) Earnings Expected to Grow: What to Know Ahead of Next Week's Release
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGIC) is projected to report a year-over-year increase in earnings despite lower revenues for the quarter ended September 2025. Investors are anticipating the earnings report on November 4, which could influence the stock price based on whether the results beat or miss expectations. The company currently has a Zacks Rank of #2 and an Earnings ESP of 0%, making a conclusive prediction for an earnings beat difficult, especially given a past earnings miss.

feed.title: IGI Appoints Malcolm Barnes as Head of Specialty Treaty
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) has appointed Malcolm Barnes as its new Head of Specialty Treaty. Based in London, Barnes will be responsible for developing and managing IGI's specialty treaty reinsurance business, bringing over 35 years of experience from the London market, including a significant tenure at Amlin Syndicate 2001. This strategic hire aims to expand IGI's reinsurance portfolio, particularly focusing on marine, energy, and terror/political violence lines.

feed.title: Is International General Insurance (IGIC) Stock Undervalued Right Now? - sharewise.com
feed.summary: Zacks.com evaluates International General Insurance (IGIC) for potential undervaluation based on its proprietary ranking system and value investing metrics. The article highlights IGIC's Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and "A" grade for Value, alongside attractive P/E and P/B ratios compared to industry averages. It concludes that IGIC appears to be a great value stock given its current valuation and strong earnings outlook.

feed.title: Is International General Insurance (IGIC) Stock Undervalued Right Now? - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: International General Insurance (IGIC) stock appears undervalued based on Zacks' ranking system and value metrics. The company sports a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) and an A grade for Value, with attractive P/E and P/B ratios compared to its industry. This suggests IGIC is a strong value stock with a promising earnings outlook.

feed.title: IGI reports increased net income of $34.1m for Q2’25
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) announced a net income of $34.1 million for Q2 2025, a 3.9% increase year-over-year, despite a rise in the combined ratio to 90.5%. The company's results were significantly impacted by the weakening of the U.S. Dollar against other major currencies, affecting underwriting income and loss reserves. IGI's CEO highlighted the benefits of their diversified strategy and specialist expertise in navigating competitive markets and currency fluctuations.

feed.title: IGI Reports Second Quarter and Half Year 2025 Unaudited Financial Results
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. ("IGI") reported unaudited financial results for the second quarter and first half of 2025. The company achieved net income of $34.1 million for Q2 2025, an increase from the prior year, despite a decline in underwriting income due to currency revaluation movements, particularly the weakening of the U.S. Dollar. IGI attributes its performance to a diversified strategy and disciplined underwriting, noting a 3.4% increase in book value per share for the first half of 2025.

feed.title: IGI to Release Second Quarter and Half Year 2024 Financial Results on August 6, 2024
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) announced that it will release its financial results for the second quarter and half year 2024 on Tuesday, August 6, 2024, after the close of the U.S. financial markets. The company will host an investor teleconference on Wednesday, August 7, 2024, to discuss these results, with details provided for access. IGI also provided a brief overview of its operations as an international specialty risks commercial insurer and reinsurer.

feed.title: IGI Announces Move to New London Offices
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) is relocating its London operations to the 15th floor of the 'Walkie-Talkie' Building at 20 Fenchurch Street on October 28, 2024. This move accommodates the company's significant growth and commitment to the London market, providing a larger space for over 130 employees and enhancing collaboration and client engagement. IGI's President and CEO, Waleed Jabsheh, highlighted the company's expansion over the past five years as the driving force behind this prestigious relocation.

feed.title: IGI grows equity by more than $100m
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) reported a significant increase in its net income and total equity for the first nine months of the year. The company's net income reached $105.1 million, a substantial rise from $85.2 million in the previous year, driven by higher net premiums and favorable changes in financial liabilities and foreign exchange. CEO Waleed Jabsheh highlighted IGI's strong performance, solid underwriting margins, and consistently growing capital base, positioning the company strongly for 2025.

feed.title: IGI reports net income of $35m for Q3’24 amid rise in net premiums earned
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) reported a net income of $34.5 million for Q3 2024, a significant increase from $10.9 million last year, primarily driven by a rise in net premiums earned. Despite a decrease in gross written premiums for the quarter, the company saw improved net investment income and a stronger performance for the nine months ending September 30, 2024, with net income up 23.3% to $105.1 million. The CEO highlighted strong underwriting margins, a favorable investment environment, and a growing capital base.

feed.title: IGI Expands in London Underwriting Hub Into Larger Offices
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. is relocating its London operations to larger offices on the 15th floor of 20 Fenchurch Street, known as the "Walkie-Talkie" building, on October 28, 2024. This move reflects the company's significant growth in its principal underwriting hub and its commitment to the London market. Over 130 people, including 60 underwriters, will occupy the new space, allowing for enhanced collaboration and engagement with clients and brokers.

feed.title: IGI Quarterly Dividend Of $0.025 Per Share
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) declared an ordinary common share dividend of $0.025 per share for the period spanning April 1, 2024, to June 30, 2024. This dividend is scheduled to be paid on September 18, 2024, to shareholders who are on record as of the close of business on September 2, 2024.

feed.title: IGI launches trading at Lloyd's of London
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd (IGI) has launched trading activities at Lloyd's of London, marking a significant step in its global expansion strategy and aiming to broaden distribution networks. Operating from Box 330A, this move coincides with robust Q1 2024 financial results, including a 4.4% increase in gross written premiums. The company expects this presence to strengthen its profile and enhance distribution capabilities in the London insurance market.

feed.title: International General Insurance Holdings Begins Trading at Lloyd’s on May 9
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. will commence trading at Lloyd’s on May 9, 2024, establishing a physical presence at Box 330A, Gallery 3, at One Lime Street. This move aims to strengthen IGI's profile and enhance distribution capabilities within the London insurance marketplace, aligning with the company's strategic goal for profitable growth. IGI, a Bermuda-domiciled re/insurer founded in 2001, underwrites a diverse portfolio of specialty lines and operates globally.

feed.title: Upbeat credit ratings affirmed for IGI Holdings
feed.summary: AM Best has affirmed the excellent credit ratings for IGI Holdings and its subsidiaries, citing the company's strong balance sheet, operating performance, and risk management. Analysts anticipate a strong financial year for the Bermuda-registered International General Insurance Co Ltd, driven by robust underwriting profitability and growth in premium revenue. The company's listing on Nasdaq enhances its financial flexibility, and its diversified business model helps mitigate risks.

feed.title: IGI marks 20th anniversary by ringing NASDAQ closing bell
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) celebrated its 20th anniversary by having Chairman and CEO Wasef Jabsheh ring the closing bell at NASDAQ MarketSite on November 17, 2022. This event marked their first return to New York City since listing on NASDAQ in March 2020. Jabsheh highlighted the company's growth and the contributions of its employees across seven global offices.

feed.title: IGI chairman rings Nasdaq’s closing bell
feed.summary: Wasef Jabsheh, chairman and CEO of Bermudian-based International General Insurance Holdings Ltd (IGI), led his team in ringing the Nasdaq closing bell to celebrate their 20th anniversary and their listing on Nasdaq. The event marked the first time the company was able to be in New York City since its 2020 listing, highlighting IGI's significant growth and enhanced brand through its partnership with Nasdaq. Mr. Jabsheh praised the IGI team across their seven global offices as the core of the company's success.

feed.title: IGI To Ring Closing Bell Today At NASDAQ
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) announced that its Chairman and CEO, Wasef Jabsheh, will lead the company in ringing the Closing Bell at NASDAQ MarketSite in Times Square on November 17, 2022, at 4:00 pm Eastern. This event marks IGI's 20th anniversary and their return to New York City for the first time since listing on NASDAQ in March 2020. Jabsheh highlighted the company's achievements and growth, attributing success to the employees across its seven global offices.

feed.title: IGI posts solid results as CEO flags attractive rate increases
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) reported strong financial results for the second quarter and first half of 2022, showcasing improved profits and growth. The company achieved a significant increase in gross written premiums and profit, alongside a healthy combined ratio, largely driven by attractive rate increases and favorable market conditions across various business lines. CEO Wasef Jabsheh emphasized the company's strong capital position and commitment to its "underwriting first" strategy for continued growth and shareholder value generation.

feed.title: IGI posts 90% rise in Q1 net profit
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) reported a 90% increase in Q1 net profit to $19 million, driven by a 27% rise in gross written premium to over $128 billion. The company's combined ratio improved significantly to 72.2% from 84.6%, reflecting an effective underwriting strategy and robust rating environment. IGI expects continued profitable growth in 2022 and anticipates minimal impact from the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

feed.title: IGI Semi-Annual Ordinary Common Dividend
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. announced a semi-annual ordinary common share dividend of $0.19 per share for the period spanning July 1, 2021, to December 31, 2021. The dividend is scheduled for payment on April 20, 2022, to shareholders of record as of April 5, 2022, with the ex-dividend date being April 4, 2022.

feed.title: AM Best Reaffirms IGI Financial Strength Rating
feed.summary: AM Best has reaffirmed International General Insurance Holdings Ltd.'s (IGI) financial strength ratings at A (Excellent) with a Stable outlook. This rating applies to all three of IGI's subsidiaries, recognizing the company's very strong balance sheet, robust underwriting, and diversified business profile. IGI Chairman and CEO Wasef Jabsheh highlighted the progress in strengthening the balance sheet and expanding the portfolio while maintaining profitable underwriting.

feed.title: IGI Launches European Subsidiary in Malta, Led by Mallia-Milanes from MAPFRE
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) has established a European subsidiary, IGI Europe, in Malta to expand its business across the continent. Keith Mallia-Milanes, previously from MAPFRE Middlesea, has been appointed as CEO of IGI Europe to lead its operations and business development. This move allows IGI to better serve European clients post-Brexit and leverage its established reputation in the market.

feed.title: S&P Affirms Global Ratings Of IGI Holdings
feed.summary: S&P Global Ratings has affirmed International General Insurance Holdings Ltd.'s financial strength ratings at A- with a Stable outlook, applying to its Bermuda and UK subsidiaries. The affirmation is based on an improved competitive position, elevated from "satisfactory" to "strong," and IGI's financial outperformance relative to peers, along with its expanding and diversifying premium base. IGI President Waleed Jabsheh highlighted the quality growth and diversification achieved in 2020, including new business in the U.S., new marine lines products, and entry into the global contingency market.

feed.title: IGI subsidiaries have ratings affirmed by S&P
feed.summary: S&P Global Ratings has affirmed the financial strength ratings of A- and stable outlook for two subsidiaries of Bermudian-based International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. The affirmation was driven by an improved competitive position, moving from "satisfactory" to "strong," and IGI's financial outperformance relative to peers. The company is pleased with the recognition of its quality growth and diversification.

feed.title: Emily Clapham joins International General Insurance
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd has appointed Emily Clapham as senior underwriter for its new contingency

feed.title: IGI to pay a dividend in April
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) has confirmed it will pay an ordinary common share dividend of $0.17 per share. This dividend covers the period from July 1, 2020, to December 31, 2020. Payment is scheduled for April 20, 2021, to shareholders on record as of April 5, 2021.

feed.title: Profits up at IGI as CEO Jabsheh heralds “successful year on many levels”
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings (IGI) reported significant year-on-year increases in net profit and gross written premiums for both Q4 and the full year of 2020. CEO Wasef Jabsheh highlighted the company's strong financial performance, expansion into new territories and lines of business, and improved combined ratio, despite a challenging global backdrop. IGI expects continued, albeit more measured, growth and opportunity in 2021, focusing on careful risk selection and portfolio balance to generate shareholder value.

feed.title: IGI hires Neon’s James as Class Underwriter for Cargo
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. has appointed Brian James as Class Underwriter for Cargo. James brings over 30 years of experience in the cargo insurance industry, joining from Neon Underwriting where he held a similar role. In his new position, he will report to Mark Trevitt and focus on developing a portfolio of general cargo insurance, especially medium-sized accounts and "war on land" risks.

feed.title: S&P Confirms Global Ratings Of IGI Holdings
feed.summary: S&P Global Ratings has reaffirmed the financial strength ratings of International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) at A- with a Stable outlook. This decision highlights IGI's strong risk-based capital adequacy, proven technical outperformance, and experienced management team, particularly after its transition to a publicly traded company in the U.S.

feed.title: IGI appoints Ian Noble as Head of Casualty and Professional Lines
feed.summary: International General Insurance Holdings Ltd. (IGI) has appointed Ian Noble as Head of Casualty and Professional Lines. Noble brings 34 years of broking and underwriting experience, most recently serving as Senior Class Underwriter at Chaucer. He will manage IGI's Casualty and Professional Lines, focusing on non-US exposures, and replace the retiring Chris Mauduit.
